{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hydroxyapatite is a naturally occurring mineral form of calcium apatite. The formula for hydroxyapatite is Ca5(PO4)3(OH), but it is usually written Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2 to denote that the crystal unit cell comprises two entities. The OH− ion can be replaced by fluoride, chloride or carbonate. Fluorapatite results from replacing the OH ion in hydroxyapatite with a fluoride ion.", "answer_choice": "A"}
